title: Top Places to visit in Nagari, Andhra Pradesh
content:
Nagari is a town in Chittoor district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is the Mandal headquarters of Nagari Mandal in the Chittoor revenue division.

 

Geography

Nagari is located at 13.33°N 79.58°E. It has an average elevation of 116 meters (380 feet). It is the 3rd Grade Municipality in the Chittoor District of Andhra Pradesh. It is spread over an area of 25.6 Sq.Km. With a population of 62275 ( 2011 Census). It is famous for Cotton weaving Sarees, Lungies, Dress Material, Desamma Temple, Kariyamanikyam Venkateswara Swamy Temple(TTD), SaiBaba Temple and Bananas

 

Location

It is located 444 km from Capital City and 67 km from District Headquarters. It was established as a 3rd-grade municipality in the year 2005. There are 4 zones and 27 election wards in this municipality

 

Topography

Nagari is located at 13 degrees/ 33 minutes’ North 79 degrees/58 minutes East. It has an average elevation of 144 meters, Nagari is situated on the Tirupati to Chennai Highway and 50 km from Tirupati and 95 km distance from Nagari to Chennai.

 

Climate and Rainfall

Nagari Town, in general, has a tropical climate, winters last from November to February, while summers last from March to June. The annual rainfall 1.62 mm, most of it received during the months of October/November & December.

 

Demography

The Population of the town which was 56832 in 2001 increased to 62275 in 2011 with an increase of 8.74% in the last decade. The sex ratio is 985 females per 1000 males. The literacy rate is 77.85 %.

 

Demographics

As of the 2011 Census of India, the town had a population of 96,152. The total population constitute, 48,058 males and 48,094 females —a sex ratio of 1000 females per 1000 males, higher than the national average of 940 per 1000. 10,518 children are in the age group of 0–6 years, of which 5,471 are boys and 5,047 are girls—a ratio of 922 per 1000. The average literacy rate stands at 65.14% with 62,640 literates, lower than the national average of 73.00%. Telugu is the official and widely spoken language in the town.

 

Education

The primary and secondary school education is imparted by government, aided and private schools, under the School Education Department of the state.

 

source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nagari,_Andhra_Pradesh

recommendations.title: Top Places to visit in Bapatla, Andhra Pradesh
recommendations.content: Bapatla is a town in Guntur district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is a municipality and the mandal headquarters of Bapatla mandal of Tenali revenue division. The nearest towns and cities to Bapatla are Tenali ,Guntur, Chirala and Ponnur of 51km ,61km, 17km, and 22km respectively.&nbs

Top Places to visit in Anantapur, Andhra Pradesh
recommendations.content: Anantapur (officially:Anantapuramu) is a city in Anantapur district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is the mandal headquarters of Anantapuramu mandal and also the divisional headquarters of Anantapur revenue division. The city is located on National Highway. It was also the headquarters
